summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 6, 2019. It details routine institutional operations, staff assignments, inmate counts, and administrative notes. The report is significant as it was created just over a month before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility, providing a snapshot of its operational status at that time.

persons.name: Inmate Johnson
persons.context: An inmate at MCC New York who was moved from housing unit 'KN' to 'ZA' on July 6, 2019.

persons.name: I/M Cherry
persons.context: An inmate at MCC New York who was reported to be at a local hospital under guard by the U.S. Marshals Service on July 6, 2019.

persons.name: Eps7e1:-.
persons.context: Appears to be a garbled or coded reference to a new admission to MCC New York, likely referring to Jeffrey Epstein, who was admitted to the facility in July 2019.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, including staff shortages leading to vacated posts, inmate movements, and a new admission.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report documents operations at MCC New York on July 6, 2019, a critical period while Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there awaiting trial.
The report notes staff shortages resulting in vacated correctional officer posts in housing units 10-South and the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
A new admission is recorded with the identifier 'Eps7e1:-. #76318-054', which is a highly probable reference to Jeffrey Epstein.
Inmate 'I/M Cherry #76218-054' was reported to be at a local hospital under guard by U.S. Marshals.
The document provides a detailed institutional inmate count of 789 at the beginning of the morning watch shift on July 6, 2019.
